articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Protesting students in Bangladesh have called for a march to the capital Dhaka on Monday in defiance of a nationwide curfew to press Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to resign, a day after deadly clashes in the South Asian country killed nearly 100 people.
articles.title: Bangladesh protest: Students call for march to force PM to quit

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike hit a tent inside a hospital compound in central Gaza, killing at least five people, bringing the total of Palestinians killed on Sunday to 19, Gaza health officials said, after another round of talks ended without result.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill five at hospital, Gaza officials say, after abortive talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw the delivery of a new tactical ballistic missile system to troops on Sunday, state media KCNA reported on Monday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim oversees delivery of new tactical ballistic missile launchers

articles.author: Nandita Bose
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is expected to announce her running mate by Tuesday after conducting interviews with top contenders at her Washington, D.C., residence over the weekend, two sources with knowledge of the matter said.
articles.title: Kamala Harris to announce vice president pick before battleground states tour

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will hold an emergency meeting with police chiefs on Monday after days of violent anti-immigration protests intensified, with buildings and vehicles torched and hotels holding asylum seekers targeted.
articles.title: UK's Starmer to hold emergency meeting as riots intensify

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Ukrainian pilots have started flying F-16s for operations within the nation, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday, confirming the long-awaited arrival of the U.S.-made fighter jets more than 29 months since Russia's invasion.
articles.title: Ukraine finally deploying F-16 fighter jets, says Zelenskiy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia on Monday raised its terror threat level to "probable" from "possible", citing an increase in extremist views in the country leading to a more than 50% chance of the planning of an onshore attack in the next 12 months.
articles.title: Australia raises terror threat level to 'probable' from 'possible'

articles.author: David Morgan, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, two states seen as must-wins in the Nov. 5 presidential election, have failed to adopt electoral reforms intended to avoid a repeat of the chaos that followed Republican Donald Trump's attempts to overturn his 2020 defeat.
articles.title: Two US battleground states seen vulnerable to post-election chaos

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon on Monday received emergency medical supplies to equip its hospitals for possible war injuries and Beirut airport was teeming with people trying to leave the country amid fears a full-scale conflict was on the horizon.
articles.title: Lebanon receives medical aid, vacationers leave amid fears of war

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Pope Francis on Monday named a new leader for the Catholic Church in Boston, succeeding the retiring archbishop, Cardinal Sean O'Malley, who has long been one of the pontiff's key U.S. advisers and a lead Vatican official on clergy sexual abuse issues.
articles.title: Boston's Cardinal O'Malley, major U.S. ally of Pope Francis, retires
